TopicTitle: [1.12.5] Bluedog Design Bureau - Stockalike Saturn, Apollo, and more! (v1.13.0 "Забытый" 13/Aug/2023)

Articles.Content: Still WIP. Deferred makes this look a lot better than without too. The PBR textures will be configured via a new shabby based solution rather than Textures Unlimited. More details to follow soon.

55 minutes ago, Zorg said:

Still WIP. Deferred makes this look a lot better than without too. The PBR textures will be configured via a new shabby based solution rather than Textures Unlimited. More details to follow soon.


Very nice. Almost photo-realistic!

For those that use Parallax, do you have colliders on or off? Having them off seems a bit weird when you are walking/driving/landing through rocks. Having them on would make for some sporty LM & Surveyor landings. I just upgraded my KSP environmental visual setup and was wondering.

Hey y'all back here again because my Google-fu is failing me.

I'm trying out a Juno IV replica to see how viable it is in RP-1 and am having a hard time finding any real sources on it. Everything I search for gives me information on the mission to Jupiter, or rockets from a certain other sandbox rocket building game...

Do y'all have any sources you could point me to? I've read that they would have used different propellant loadings for different types of missions, but haven't seen any sort of numbers associated with that. And is the quoted TLI mass supposed to be doable by the liquid stages alone, or does that include the Baby Sergeant stages that Friznit has in the build guide, which I haven't seen referenced in any of the sources I have found. I'm not sure how much of this is based on actual design studies or speculation.

I'm trying out a Juno IV replica to see how viable it is in RP-1 and am having a hard time finding any real sources on it. Everything I search for gives me information on the mission to Jupiter, or rockets from a certain other sandbox rocket building game...

Do y'all have any sources you could point me to? I've read that they would have used different propellant loadings for different types of missions, but haven't seen any sort of numbers associated with that. And is the quoted TLI mass supposed to be doable by the liquid stages alone, or does that include the Baby Sergeant stages that Friznit has in the build guide, which I haven't seen referenced in any of the sources I have found. I'm not sure how much of this is based on actual design studies or speculation.

Try this: https://web.archive.org/web/20220406013827/http://www.spacelaunchreport.com/jupiter7.html

It is an archived site, so it isn’t being updated anymore. However, the author Ed Kyle still regularly participates in the NASASpaceflight.com forums. You could post there and you may get an answer.

Titan IV with LRBs - One of the considered alternatives to SRMU development



Each booster is powered by 5 LR-87's, meaning the full stack has 15 engines in total, 12 being LR-87s

Here is the doc I used. You're right that there's mention of flying with different fuel loads for different missions, but frankly I never understood that. I believe there is also some mention of just assuming the thrust of the first stage engine could be doubled. Both are patterns I've seen from the stuff coming out of Redstone/Marshall in that era.

As for the Baby Sergeants, yeah those shouldn't be there. Just Friznit being Friznit

5 hours ago, GoldForest said:

Nothing out of the ordinary here. Nope. No siree. Nothing. Zip. Nadda. 

Full album: Imgur: The magic of the Internet

 

No no no!  Where is the Sus!?

Delta IV SUS = Delta K tank with Delta KX engine (it is close enough given how little data we have on SUS)

SUS = Delta IV Light/Lite  = Storable Upper Stage.   And yes, the Atlas SUS and the Delta SUS are not related even thought they have the same root name.

 

Ok joking and minor historical points asside, what did you use for your SRMs?

 

Edited yesterday at 03:25 PM by Pappystein

I used the H-IIA 2024 SRBs and layout.

I'm having a very dumb problem and i don't know what log files to look at to troubleshoot it.

interactive IVAs are only working in the mercury capsule, but not the gemini or apollo capsules. Sorry to ask for help with such a basic thing as diagnostics. It's probably something like i forgot a mod.

46 minutes ago, Kellanium said:

I'm having a very dumb problem and i don't know what log files to look at to troubleshoot it.

interactive IVAs are only working in the mercury capsule, but not the gemini or apollo capsules. Sorry to ask for help with such a basic thing as diagnostics. It's probably something like i forgot a mod.

Copy/Grab your:
KSP.log (Found in the main directory next to the .exe file.)
ModuleManager.log (Found in the Logs folder)
ModuleManager.configcache (Found in your gamedata)

Zip/Rar them together

Then upload them to a file sharing site like Github or Dropbox or GoogleDrive.

Then post a link to the download here so we can take a look. 

Edited 17 hours ago by GoldForest

I am. If i select 'stock', 'bdb,' or 'bdb alternate' for the gemini in the VAB it will load those, but if i switch with reviva to any of the others (RPM, DE+MAS, etc) the little kerbal portraits disappear and don't return even if i switch back to one that works, and i cannot enter the cockpit. With both the Apollo and the Apollo Block III the only thing that works is "stock." It's weird. I've uninstalled + reinstalled every mod i can think of that might be related.

It's not a gamebreaker but it is disappointing.
